  • Method Details

    • showInfoDialog

      public static void showInfoDialog​(String message, String text)
      Shows a Dialog with the specified getText displayed.

      A WebView is used to display the specified getText.

      Can be called off of the FX thread.

      Parameters:
      text - The text to display for the user. Null to use the title as the text.
      message - The text to be displayed.

    • showInfoDialog

      public static void showInfoDialog​(String title, String message, String text)
      Shows a Dialog with the specified text displayed.

      A WebView is used to display the specified text.

      Can be called off of the FX thread.

      Parameters:
      title - The title of the dialog window. Null for no title.
      message - The message to be displayed on the dialog window.
      text - The text to be displayed.

    • showMessageDialog

      public static void showMessageDialog​(String title, String message)
      Shows a new message dialog with the specified message getText.

      The difference between this method and showInfoDialog(String, String) is that this method uses a simple Label to display the message rather than a WebView.

      Can be called off of the FX thread.

      Parameters:
      title - The title of the Dialog.
      message - The message to display for the user. Null to use the title as the message.

    • showConfirmDialog

      public static boolean showConfirmDialog​(String title, String message)
      Shows a confirm Dialog.
      Parameters:
      message - The message to display for the user. Null to use the title as the message.
      Returns:
      True if the Yes option is chosen, false if the No option is chosen (or if the Dialog is closed).

    • showYesNoCancelDialog

      public static javafx.scene.control.ButtonBar.ButtonData showYesNoCancelDialog​(String title, String message)
      Shows a Yes, No, or Cancel option Dialog.
      Parameters:
      title - The title of the Dialog.
      message - The message to display for the user. Null to use the title as the message.
      Returns:
      The ButtonBar.ButtonData that was selected by the user, or null if the Dialog was closed.

    • showIntDialog

      public static int showIntDialog​(String title, String message, int... initialValue)
      Shows a Dialog that allows the user to enter an integer value.
      Parameters:
      title - The title of the Dialog.
      message - The message to display for the user. Null to use the title as the message.
      initialValue - The initial value (always uses first element). Null or empty for default.
      Returns:
      The integer that the user entered, or 0 if the Dialog was cancelled or closed.

    • showLongDialog

      public static long showLongDialog​(String title, String message, long... initialValue)
      Shows a Dialog that allows the user to enter a long value.
      Parameters:
      title - The title of the Dialog.
      message - The message to display for the user. Null to use the title as the message.\
      initialValue - The initial value (always uses first element). Null or empty for default.
      Returns:
      The long that the user entered, or 0 if the Dialog was cancelled or closed.

    • showDoubleDialog

      public static double showDoubleDialog​(String title, String message, double... initialValue)
      Shows a Dialog that allows the user to enter a number (double) value.
      Parameters:
      title - The title of the Dialog.
      message - The message to display for the user. Null to use the title as the message.
      Returns:
      The number(double) that the user entered, or 0.0 if the Dialog was cancelled or closed.

    • showStringDialog

      public static String showStringDialog​(String title, String message, boolean allowEmpty, String... initialValue)
      Shows a Dialog that allows the user to enter a String value using a TextField.
      Parameters:
      title - The title of the Dialog.
      message - The message to display for the user. Null to use the title as the message.
      allowEmpty - True if the Dialog should accept empty Strings, false if the Dialog should force the user to enter in at least 1 character (or close the Dialog).
      Returns:
      The String that the user entered, or null if the Dialog was cancelled or closed.

    • showTextDialog

      public static String showTextDialog​(String title, String message, String... initialValue)
      Shows a Dialog that allows the user to enter a large String value using a TextArea.
      Parameters:
      title - The title of the Dialog.
      message - The message to display for the user. Null to use the title as the message.
      Returns:
      The String that the user entered, or null if the Dialog was cancelled or closed.

    • showChooseOptionDialog

      @SafeVarargs public static <T> T showChooseOptionDialog​(String title, String message, FXTools.AutoCompleteMode autoCompleteMode, T defaultOption, boolean selectFirst, String promptText, T... options)
      Shows a Dialog that allows the user to choose a value from the specified array of potential values.
      Type Parameters:
      T - The type of element in the ComboBox.
      Parameters:
      title - The title of the Dialog.
      message - The message to display for the user. Null to use the title as the message.
      autoCompleteMode - The FXTools.AutoCompleteMode, or null if the ComboBox is not an auto-complete box.
      defaultOption - The default option that the ComboBox returns if the user does not select a value.
      options - The array of potential options that the user can choose.
      Returns:
      The value that the user chose from the ComboBox, or the default value if the Dialog was cancelled or closed.

    • showChooseEnumDialog

      public static <T extends Enum> T showChooseEnumDialog​(String title, String message, FXTools.AutoCompleteMode autoCompleteMode, T defaultOption, String promptText, boolean selectFirst)
      Shows a Dialog that allows the user to choose a value from all of the available enum values based on the specified default option enum.
      Type Parameters:
      T - The type of element in the ComboBox.
      Parameters:
      title - The title of the Dialog.
      message - The message to display for the user. Null to use the title as the message.
      autoCompleteMode - The FXTools.AutoCompleteMode, or null if the ComboBox is not an auto-complete box.
      defaultOption - The default option that the ComboBox returns if the user does not select a value.
      Returns:
      The value that the user chose from the ComboBox, or the default value if the Dialog was cancelled or closed.
      See Also:
      showChooseOptionDialog(String, String, FXTools.AutoCompleteMode, Object, boolean, String, Object[])

    • showChooseOptionsDialog

      @SafeVarargs public static <T> T[] showChooseOptionsDialog​(String title, String message, T[] empty, T... options)
      Shows a ListView that allows the user to choose any number of values from the specified array of potential values.
      Type Parameters:
      T - The type of element in the ListView.
      Parameters:
      title - The title of the Dialog.
      message - The message to display for the user. Null to use the title as the message.
      options - The array of potential options that the user can choose.
      empty - The values to be returned when empty.
      Returns:
      The values that the user has selected from the ListView, or the default value if the Dialog was cancelled or closed.

    • showControllableDialog

      public static <R> R showControllableDialog​(String title, String message, double spacing, javafx.scene.control.ButtonType[] buttonTypes, boolean launch, DialogController<R> controller)
      Shows a Dialog with the specified controller as the base.
      Parameters:
      title - The title of the Dialog.
      message - The message to display for the user. Null to use the title as the message.
      spacing - The spacing around the Node. Use 0 for no spacing (Node will not be encased in a parent container).
      buttonTypes - The button types defining the buttons to be displayed at the base of the Dialog.
      launch - True if the DialogController should be launched before being displayed in the Dialog, false otherwise.
      controller - The DialogController that is being displayed.
      Returns:
      The value returned by the callback of the DialogController, or null if the DialogController has not been initialized.

    • showDialog

      public static void showDialog​(String title, String message, javafx.scene.Node content, FXDialogTools.SizeType sizeType)
      Shows a Dialog with the specified content and title. Does not use a DialogCallback.

      This method is typically used for testing, or can also be used to display simple information to the user, such as an Image.

      Parameters:
      title - The title of the Dialog window.
      message - The message to display for the user. The message is displayed directly above the content.

      Null to use the title as the message, empty to display no message.

      content - The contents of the Dialog window.
      sizeType - The FXDialogTools.SizeType that controls how the Dialog can be resized. Null to not use a FXDialogTools.SizeType.

      Note that FXDialogTools.SizeType.MINIMUM_SIZE does NOT work for dialogs.

    • showDialog

      public static <T> T showDialog​(String title, javafx.scene.Node content, javafx.scene.control.ButtonType[] buttonTypes, FXDialogTools.SizeType sizeType, DialogCallback<T> callback)
      Shows a Dialog with the specified Node content using the specified DialogCallback.
      Type Parameters:
      T - The type of content returned by the DialogCallback.
      Parameters:
      title - The title of the dialog window. Null for no title.
      content - The Node content of the Dialog.
      buttonTypes - The button types defining the buttons to be displayed at the base of the Dialog.
      sizeType - The FXDialogTools.SizeType that controls how the Dialog can be resized. Null to not use a FXDialogTools.SizeType.

      Note that FXDialogTools.SizeType.MINIMUM_SIZE does NOT work for dialogs.

      callback - The DialogCallback. Null to not use a callback. Using a null callback will cause this method to always return null.
      Returns:
      The value returned by the DialogCallback.

    • showDialog

      public static <T> T showDialog​(String title, String message, javafx.scene.Node content, javafx.scene.Node contentToFocus, double spacing, javafx.scene.control.ButtonType[] buttonTypes, FXDialogTools.SizeType sizeType, DialogCallback<T> callback)
      Shows a Dialog with the specified Node content using the specified DialogCallback.
      Type Parameters:
      T - The type of content returned by the DialogCallback.
      Parameters:
      title - The title of the dialog window. Null for no title.
      message - The message to display for the user. The message is displayed directly above the content.

      Empty to use the title as the message, null to display no message.

      content - The Node content of the Dialog.
      contentToFocus - The Node content that is to be focused immediately after the Dialog is shown. Null to focus the content.
      spacing - The spacing around the Node. Use -1 for default spacing, or 0 for no spacing.
      buttonTypes - The button types defining the buttons to be displayed at the base of the Dialog.
      sizeType - The FXDialogTools.SizeType that controls how the Dialog can be resized. Null to not use a FXDialogTools.SizeType.

      Note that FXDialogTools.SizeType.MINIMUM_SIZE does NOT work for dialogs.

      callback - The DialogCallback. Null to not use a callback. Using a null callback will cause this method to always return null.
      Returns:
      The value returned by the DialogCallback.

    • buttonData

      public static javafx.scene.control.ButtonBar.ButtonData[] buttonData​(javafx.scene.control.ButtonType[] buttonTypes)
      Returns an array of ButtonBar.ButtonData values based on the specified array of ButtonType values.
      Parameters:
      buttonTypes - The array of ButtonType values.
      Returns:
      An array of ButtonBar.ButtonData values based on the specified array of ButtonType values.

    • closeAll

      public static void closeAll()
      Closes all currently open dialogs.
